queries.description: Check if containers are running with low UID, which might cause conflicts with the host's user table.
Memory limits should be defined for each container. This prevents potential resource exhaustion by ensuring that containers consume not more than the designated amount of memory
Memory requests should be defined for each container. This allows the kubelet to reserve the requested amount of system resources and prevents over-provisioning on individual nodes
Containers should drop 'ALL' or at least 'NET_RAW' capabilities

queries.query_name: RBAC Roles with Read Secrets Permissions
queries.description: Roles and ClusterRoles with get/watch/list RBAC permissions on Kubernetes secrets are dangerous and should be avoided. In case of compromise, attackers could abuse these roles to access sensitive data, such as passwords, tokens and keys

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{kubewarden-controller-manager-namespaced-role}}.rules[0] should not be granted read access to Secrets objects
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{kubewarden-controller-manager-namespaced-role}}.rules[0] is granted read access (verbs: get, create, patch, update, delete, list, watch) to Secrets objects

queries.description: Containers should be configured with a secure Seccomp profile to restrict potentially dangerous syscalls

queries.query_name: Service Account Token Automount Not Disabled
queries.description: Service Account Tokens are automatically mounted even if not necessary

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-kubewarden-controller}}.spec.template.spec.automountServiceAccountToken should be defined and set to false
metadata.name={{audit-scanner}}.spec.jobTemplate.spec.template.spec.automountServiceAccountToken should be defined and set to false
metadata.name={{release-name}}.spec.template.spec.automountServiceAccountToken should be defined and set to false
metadata.name={{release-name-delete-pre-1-11-policyreports-job}}.spec.template.spec.automountServiceAccountToken should be defined and set to false

queries.description: Roles and ClusterRoles when binded, should not use get, list or watch as verbs

files.expected_value: The metadata.name={{kubewarden-controller-manager-namespaced-role}}.rules.verbs should not contain the following verbs: [["get", "create", "patch", "update", "delete", "list", "watch"]]

queries.description: A Service Account token is shared between workloads

files.expected_value: 'spec.template.spec.serviceAccountName' should not be shared with other workloads
'spec.jobTemplate.spec.template.spec.serviceAccountName' should not be shared with other workloads
'spec.template.spec.serviceAccountName' should not be shared with other workloads
'spec.template.spec.serviceAccountName' should not be shared with other workloads

'metadata.namespace' should not be set to default, kube-system or kube-public

queries.description: CPU limits should be set because if the system has CPU time free, a container is guaranteed to be allocated as much CPU as it requests
CPU requests should be set to ensure the sum of the resource requests of the scheduled Containers is less than the capacity of the node
Cronjobs must have a configured deadline, which means the attribute 'startingDeadlineSeconds' must be defined

queries.query_name: Image Pull Policy Of The Container Is Not Set To Always
queries.description: Image Pull Policy of the container must be defined and set to Always

files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-kubewarden-controller}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{manager}}.imagePullPolicy relies on mutable images in cache
metadata.name={{audit-scanner}}.spec.jobTemplate.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{audit-scanner}}.imagePullPolicy relies on mutable images in cache
metadata.name={{release-name}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{pre-delete-job}}.imagePullPolicy relies on mutable images in cache
metadata.name={{release-name-delete-pre-1-11-policyreports-job}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{delete-pre-1-11-policyreports-job}}.imagePullPolicy relies on mutable images in cache

queries.description: Containers should be configured with an AppArmor profile to enforce fine-grained access control over low-level system resources

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-kubewarden-controller}}.spec.template.metadata.annotations should specify an AppArmor profile for container {{manager}}
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-kubewarden-controller}}.spec.template.metadata.annotations does not specify an AppArmor profile for container {{manager}}

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name}}.spec.template.metadata.annotations should specify an AppArmor profile for container {{pre-delete-job}}
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name}}.spec.template.metadata.annotations does not specify an AppArmor profile for container {{pre-delete-job}}

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{audit-scanner}}.annotations should specify an AppArmor profile for container {{audit-scanner}}
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{audit-scanner}}.annotations does not specify an AppArmor profile for container {{audit-scanner}}

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-delete-pre-1-11-policyreports-job}}.spec.template.metadata.annotations should specify an AppArmor profile for container {{delete-pre-1-11-policyreports-job}}
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-delete-pre-1-11-policyreports-job}}.spec.template.metadata.annotations does not specify an AppArmor profile for container {{delete-pre-1-11-policyreports-job}}

queries.description: Sees if Kubernetes Drop Capabilities exists to ensure containers security context
Each namespace should have a LimitRange policy associated to ensure that resource allocations of Pods, Containers and PersistentVolumeClaims do not exceed the defined boundaries

files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-delete-pre-1-11-policyreports-job}} does not have a 'LimitRange' policy associated
metadata.name={{release-name-kubewarden-controller}} does not have a 'LimitRange' policy associated
metadata.name={{audit-scanner}} does not have a 'LimitRange' policy associated
metadata.name={{release-name}} does not have a 'LimitRange' policy associated

queries.description: Each namespace should have a ResourceQuota policy associated to limit the total amount of resources Pods, Containers and PersistentVolumeClaims can consume

files.actual_value: metadata.name={{audit-scanner}} does not have a 'ResourceQuota' policy associated
metadata.name={{release-name-kubewarden-controller}} does not have a 'ResourceQuota' policy associated
metadata.name={{release-name-delete-pre-1-11-policyreports-job}} does not have a 'ResourceQuota' policy associated
metadata.name={{release-name}} does not have a 'ResourceQuota' policy associated

queries.description: Check if the root container filesystem is not being mounted read-only.
Service should Target a Pod
